intro: Lasianthus brevipedunculatus, commonly known as the short-stalked flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, exotic blooms.
